headline.main: Did Colorado Go Too Far With Pot?

docs.abstract: Was the move to legalize marijuana done too quickly? Do changes need to be made to their approach?
docs.snippet: Was the move to legalize marijuana done too quickly? Do changes need to be made to their approach?

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Pro Bowl defender Marcellus Wiley added his name to a lawsuit accusing NFL teams of illegally dispensing powerful narcotics and other drugs to keep players on the field without regard for their long-term health.

headline.main: Second Wave of Former Players Join NFL Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Second Wave of Former Players Join NFL Lawsuit

docs.snippet: Former Pro Bowl defender Marcellus Wiley added his name to a lawsuit accusing NFL teams of illegally dispensing powerful narcotics and other drugs to keep players on the field without regard for their long-term health.

docs.abstract: An ingenious cellphone verification system is just one of the methods being used to combat deadly counterfeit medications in Africa.
docs.snippet: An ingenious cellphone verification system is just one of the methods being used to combat deadly counterfeit medications in Africa.

docs.lead_paragraph: Enforcement of Arizona regulations curbing access to abortion-inducing drugs by prohibiting off-label uses of the medication will remain on hold while a legal challenge to those rules proceeds under judicial review, a federal appeals court ruled on Tuesday.

headline.main: Arizona Abortion Drug Restrictions to Stay Blocked Pending Appeal

docs.lead_paragraph: The city of Chicago has filed a lawsuit against five large narcotics makers alleging they contributed to the country’s prescription drug epidemic by deceptively promoting their painkillers.

headline.main: Chicago Sues Painkiller Makers for Deceptive Marketing
headline.print_headline: Chicago Sues Painkiller Makers for Deceptive Marketing

docs.snippet: The city of Chicago has filed a lawsuit against five large narcotics makers alleging they contributed to the country’s prescription drug epidemic by deceptively promoting their painkillers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's strictest rules on the use of abortion drugs are likely to be struck down and will continue to be blocked while a lawsuit against them plays out, a federal appeals court ruled Tuesday.

headline.main: Arizona Abortion Restrictions to Remain Blocked
headline.print_headline: Arizona Abortion Restrictions to Remain Blocked

docs.snippet: The nation's strictest rules on the use of abortion drugs are likely to be struck down and will continue to be blocked while a lawsuit against them plays out, a federal appeals court ruled Tuesday.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: France's Direct Appeal on Bank

docs.abstract: French officials are appealing to the United States on behalf of BNP Paribas. | Valeant’s bid for Allergan raises a question about the role of drug companies. | Pilgrim’s Pride raises its bid for Hillshire Brands. | Trouble may be brewing at Salesforce.

docs.lead_paragraph: Words matter. Putting a label on normal variations of physiology can cause needless worry, spending and even bodily harm.

headline.main: Calling an Ordinary Health Problem a Disease Leads to Bigger Problems
headline.print_headline: The Trouble With Labeling a Health Problem a Disease

docs.abstract: The Upshot; labeling of patients with a 'disease' can have significant consequences; putting a label on normal variations of physiology can cause needless worry, spending and even bodily harm.
docs.snippet: Words matter. Putting a label on normal variations of physiology can cause needless worry, spending and even bodily harm.

docs.lead_paragraph: Adult deaths and children’s emergency room visits in Colorado are being linked to newly legal marijuana, often in its edible form, and opponents of legalization are warning other states to pay heed.

headline.main: After 5 Months of Sales, Colorado Sees the Downside of a Legal High
headline.print_headline: After 5 Months of Sales, Colorado Sees the Downside of a Legal High

docs.abstract: Battle over legalization of recreational marijuana sales in Colorado is still raging, five months after it was enacted; adult deaths and children’s emergency room visits in state are being linked to potent doses of newly legal marijuana, often in its edible form, and opponents of legalization are warning other states to pay heed.
docs.snippet: Adult deaths and children’s emergency room visits in Colorado are being linked to newly legal marijuana, often in its edible form, and opponents of legalization are warning other states to pay heed.

docs.lead_paragraph: Too often, companies hide dangers from regulators by reaching legal settlements that are conditioned on silence.
docs.abstract: Editorial decries corporate practice of reaching legal settlements with victims that include conditions of silence, such as those that allowed General Motors to hide lethal flaws in ignition switches for more than a decade; supports legislation that would make it harder for companies to hide behind private agreements with plaintiffs.
docs.snippet: Too often, companies hide dangers from regulators by reaching legal settlements that are conditioned on silence.
